com.ojcoleman.bain.base

Class ComponentCollection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amd.aparapi.Kernel
      • com.ojcoleman.bain.base.ComponentCollection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConfigurableComponentCollection

    public abstract class ComponentCollection
extends com.amd.aparapi.Kernel

    Base class for all collections of specific types of neural network components to be used in a NeuralNetwork. A type of component (e.g. a ) is contained in a collection so as to allow off-loading parallel computations to a vector processor (eg GPU) using Aparapi: simulation calculations should be performed on arrays of primitives containing the state variables, inputs and outputs for the components in the collection.

    Rather than extending from this class directly, generally implementations should extend a more specific collection sub-class, such as NeuronCollection or SynapseCollection, which provide some useful functionality and an API for working with that type of component. This allows it to be used alongside other standard collection types and within classes like NeuralNetwork.

    The computations for a collection should be performed in the run() method, which overrides the com.amd.aparapi.Kernel run() method. The step() method invokes com.amd.aparapi.Kernel.execute(size), which invokes the run() method. See the Aparapi documentation for more details and sub-classes of NeuronCollection and SynapseCollection for examples. For performance reasons, the step() method invokes execute() with sizePower2 rather than the actual size. This means that a sub-class must either:

    1. force the actual size to be a power of 2; or
    2. add logic to the run() method such that it skips components whose index is >= size; or
    3. Add dummy elements to all component state variable, input and output arrays such that they have length sizePower2.

    It is assumed that the Aparapi kernel is set to use explicit buffer management, meaning that the required arrays/buffers must be sent to and retrieved from the execution hardware (eg GPU) manually using get() and put() (defined in com.amd.aparapi.Kernel) as necessary. Sub-classes of this class, including ConfigurableComponentCollection, NeuronCollection and SynapseCollection, do this for the arrays/buffers they declare, which is one reason that when overriding methods such as init(), reset() and step() the super-method should be invoked from within the overriding method. See ensureOutputsAreFresh() and ensureStateVariablesAreFresh().

    Author:
    Oliver J. Coleman
    See Also:
    Aparapi home page

      • size

        protected int size
        The number of components in this collection.

      • sizePower2

        protected int sizePower2
        A number >= to size that is a power of 2.

      • outputs

        protected double[] outputs
        The current output values of the components.

      • executeRange

        protected com.amd.aparapi.Range executeRange
        The Aparapi execution range.

      • network

        protected NeuralNetwork network
        The containing network.

      • stateVariablesStale

        protected boolean stateVariablesStale
        Flag to indicate if the state variables used in an Aparapi kernel have been modified on the GPU (and so would need to be transferred back if we're interested in looking at their values). This is only relevant when explicit buffer management is being used.

      • outputsStale

        protected boolean outputsStale
        Flag to indicate if the outputs as calculated in an Aparapi kernel have been modified on the GPU (and so would need to be transferred back if we're interested in looking at their values). This is only relevant when explicit buffer management is being used.
        See Also:
        ensureOutputsAreFresh(), outputsAreStale()

      • outputsModified

        protected boolean outputsModified
        Flag to indicate if the output values have been manually modified since the last simulation step.

      • inputsStale

        protected boolean inputsStale
        Flag to indicate if the inputs as calculated in an Aparapi kernel have been modified on the GPU (and so would need to be transferred back if we're interested in looking at their values). This is only relevant when explicit buffer management is being used.
        See Also:
        ensureInputsAreFresh(), inputsAreStale()

    • Constructor Detail

      • ComponentCollection

        public ComponentCollection()

    • Method Detail

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Get the total number of components in this collection.
        See Also:
        getSizePopulated()

      • getSizePopulated

        public int getSizePopulated()
        Get the number of populated/used components in this collection. This may be set to less than getSize() so that only a subset of the components are executed. This is useful when the same collection object is being recycled to simulate different networks, some of which may be smaller than the maximum size.

      • setSizePopulated

        public void setSizePopulated(int sizePopulated)
        Set the number of populated components in this collection. This may be set to less than getSize() so that only a subset of the components are executed. This is useful when the same collection object is being recycled to simulate different networks, some of which may be smaller than the maximum size.
        See Also:
        SynapseCollection.compress()

      • getNetwork

        public NeuralNetwork getNetwork()
        Get the containing network.

      • setNetwork

        public void setNetwork(NeuralNetwork network)
        Set the containing network. Causes this collection to be reinitialised (via init()), and reset (via reset()).

      • init

        public void init()
        Initialise the collection. This method should be called from a sub-classes constructor. Sub-classes should override this method to generate pre-calculated values used during the simulation, and call this super-method. Arrays/buffers initialised here and used in the run() method/kernel should be transferred to the execution hardware using put().

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset the components to their initial state. Sub-classes should override this method if they have state variables that may be reset to an initial state. Arrays/buffers reset here and used in the run() method/kernel should be transferred to the execution hardware using put().

      • step

        public void step()
        Update the model over one time step. Sub-classes should call this super method. The step() method will invoke the overridden run() method which defines the Aparapi kernel. This method sets stateVariablesStale and outputsStale to true.

      • getOutput

        public double getOutput(int index)
        Returns the output of the specified component for the last time step.

      • getOutputs

        public double[] getOutputs()
        Returns a reference to the internal output value array, to allow efficient getting and setting of output values. If reading values from the returned array, this method must be called after every call to NeuralNetwork.step() or NeuralNetwork.run(int). This will ensure that the current values are retrieved from the SIMD hardware (eg GPU) if necessary. If setting values in the returned array the method setOutputsModified() must be called.. This will ensure that the modified values are pushed to the SIMD hardware if necessary during the next simulation step.

      • setOutput

        public void setOutput(int index,
             double newOutput)
        Set current output value for a component. This will be used in the next step of the simulation.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the component to set the output value for.
        newOutput - The new output value.

      • getInput

        public abstract double getInput(int index)
        Returns the input value of the specified component for the next time step.

      • getInputs

        public abstract double[] getInputs()
        Returns the underlying array of input values. This method is provided for efficiency reasons, the values of the array should not be altered directly. The values in the array returned by this method may become stale if the step() method is invoked subsequently; to get fresh values this method should be invoked again (this will return the same array but will also ensure that the values in the array are up to date by invoking ensureInputsAreFresh()).

      • addInput

        public abstract void addInput(int index,
            double input)
        Add input to the specified component. The given input is added onto the existing input value.

      • ensureOutputsAreFresh

        public void ensureOutputsAreFresh()
        Ensures the outputs, as provided by getOutput(int index) and getOutputs() have been fetched from the remote execution hardware (eg GPU) if necessary. See outputsAreStale().

      • outputsAreStale

        public boolean outputsAreStale()
        Returns true iff the output values of the components, provided by getOutput(int index) and getOutputs() have become stale due to being altered on remote execution hardware (eg GPU) and not yet being fetched back.

      • outputsModified

        public boolean outputsModified()
        Returns:
        true iff the outputs have been manually modified since the last simulation step.

      • setOutputsModified

        public void setOutputsModified()
        This must be called if the outputs have been manually modified since the last simulation step.

      • setOutputsModified

        public void setOutputsModified(int start,
                      int length)
        This must be called if the outputs have been manually modified since the last simulation step. This method allows specifying the range of components for which outputs were modified. The range information is not used directly by this class but may be used by subclasses.
        Parameters:
        start - The index of the start of the range.
        length - The length of the range.

      • ensureInputsAreFresh

        public abstract void ensureInputsAreFresh()
        Ensures the inputs, as provided by getInput(int index) and getInputs() have been fetched from the remote execution hardware (eg GPU) if necessary. See inputsAreStale().

      • inputsAreStale

        public boolean inputsAreStale()
        Returns true iff the input values of the components, provided by getInput(int index) and getInputs() have become stale due to being altered on remote execution hardware (eg GPU) and not yet being fetched back.

      • stateVariablesAreStale

        public boolean stateVariablesAreStale()
        Returns true iff the state variables of the components, provided by getStateVariableValues(int index) have become stale due to being altered on remote execution hardware (eg GPU) and not yet being fetched back.

      • ensureStateVariablesAreFresh

        public abstract void ensureStateVariablesAreFresh()
        Ensure the state variable values have been fetched from the remote execution hardware (eg GPU) if necessary. See stateVariablesStale. Implementations of this method should set stateVariablesStale to false. (If sub-classes override an implementation of this method they should typically call the super method after they have fetched any data from the remote execution hardware as the overridden implementation of this method should set stateVariablesStale false).

      • getStateVariableNames

        public java.lang.String[] getStateVariableNames()
        Get an array containing the names of all the internal state variables. Sub-classes may override this to allow the component to be used for testing or educational purposes.

      • getStateVariableValues

        public double[] getStateVariableValues(int componentIndex)
        Get an array containing the values of all the internal state variables, in the same order as that given by getStateVariableNames(). Sub-classes may override this to allow the component to be used for testing or educational purposes. The overriding method should ensure the state variables are up to date by invoking ensureStateVariablesAreFresh().

      • getMinimumPossibleOutputValue

        public double getMinimumPossibleOutputValue()
        Returns the lowest possible output value for components in this collection. The default implementation returns 0, sub-classes should override this if necessary.

      • getMaximumPossibleOutputValue

        public double getMaximumPossibleOutputValue()
        Returns the largest possible output value for components in this collection. The default implementation returns 1, sub-classes should override this if necessary.

      • setExecutionMode

        public void setExecutionMode(com.amd.aparapi.Kernel.EXECUTION_MODE mode)

        This overridden method ensures that when SEQ mode is specified a valid execution Range, with group size == 1, is used.

        Overrides:
        setExecutionMode in class com.amd.aparapi.Kernel
